token with purchase, yield distribution, staking, and transfer limits for real estate tokenization and rental yield distribution.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint256,uint256)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `spender`\u2019s `allowance`. Used in transfers.","params":{"allowance":"Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.","needed":"Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.","spender":"Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner."}}],"ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256,uint256)":[{"details":"Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.","params":{"balance":"Current balance for the interacting account.","needed":"Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.","sender":"Address whose tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC20InvalidApprover(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.","params":{"approver":"Address initiating an approval operation."}}],"ERC20InvalidReceiver(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.","params":{"receiver":"Address to which tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC20InvalidSender(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.","params":{"sender":"Address whose tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC20InvalidSpender(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.","params":{"spender":"Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner."}}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"events":{"Approval(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Transfer(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"burn(uint256)":{"details":"Burns tokens with limit enforcement","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to burn"}},"calculateClaimableYield(address)":{"details":"Calculates claimable yield for an account","params":{"account":"Address to calculate yield for"},"returns":{"_0":"Total claimable yield"}},"claimYield()":{"details":"Allows users to claim their yield","returns":{"_0":"Amount of yield claimed"}},"constructor":{"details":"Initializes the contract with token parameters","params":{"initialTokenPrice":"Initial price per token in wei","initialYieldRate":"Initial annual yield rate in basis points","name":"Token name","symbol":"Token symbol"}},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"distributeYield()":{"details":"Distributes yield to token holders Can only be called by yield manager role"},"emergencyWithdraw(address)":{"details":"Emergency withdrawal of ETH from contract","params":{"recipient":"Address to receive the ETH"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getStakingPositions(address)":{"details":"Gets all staking positions for an account","params":{"account":"Address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of staking positions"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"purchaseTokens()":{"details":"Allows users to purchase tokens with ETH","returns":{"_0":"Amount of tokens purchased"}},"recoverERC20(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emergency recovery of ERC20 tokens sent to contract","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to recover","recipient":"Address to receive the tokens","tokenAddress":"Address of the token to recover"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setAnnualYieldRate(uint256)":{"details":"Sets the annual yield rate","params":{"newRate":"New annual yield rate in basis points"}},"setPaused(bool)":{"details":"Pauses or unpauses all token transfers","params":{"_paused":"New paused state"}},"setPropertyReference(address,uint256)":{"details":"Sets the property reference for this token","params":{"_propertyId":"ID of the property token","_propertyToken":"Address of the property token contract"}},"setTokenPrice(uint256)":{"details":"Sets the token price","params":{"newPrice":"New price per token in wei"}},"setTransferLimitExempt(address,bool)":{"details":"Sets transfer limit exemption for an account","params":{"account":"Address to set exemption for","exempt":"Whether the account is exempt from transfer limits"}},"setTransferLimits(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Sets transfer and burn limits","params":{"newMaxBurn":"New maximum burn percentage in basis points","newMaxTransfer":"New maximum transfer percentage in basis points"}},"setYieldDistributionPeriod(uint256)":{"details":"Sets the yield distribution period","params":{"newPeriod":"New distribution period in seconds"}},"stakeTokens(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Allows users to stake tokens for bonus yield","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to stake","lockPeriod":"Period to lock tokens in seconds"},"returns":{"_0":"Index of the staking position"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"Override the transfer function to enforce transfer limits"},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Override the transferFrom function to enforce transfer limits"},"unstakeTokens(uint256)":{"details":"Allows users to unstake tokens after lock period","params":{"positionIndex":"Index of the staking approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

calculateClaimableYield(address).details: Calculates claimable yield for an account

claimYield().details: Allows users to claim their yield

constructor.details: Initializes the contract with token parameters

params.initialTokenPrice: Initial price per token in wei
params.initialYieldRate: Initial annual yield rate in basis points
params.name: Token name

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

distributeYield().details: Distributes yield to token holders Can only be called by yield manager role

emergencyWithdraw(address).details: Emergency withdrawal of ETH from contract

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getStakingPositions(address).details: Gets all staking positions for an account

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

purchaseTokens().details: Allows users to purchase tokens with ETH

recoverERC20(address,address,uint256).details: Emergency recovery of ERC20 tokens sent to contract

params.tokenAddress: Address of the token to recover

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.newRate: New annual yield rate in basis points

setPaused(bool).details: Pauses or unpauses all token transfers

setPropertyReference(address,uint256).details: Sets the property reference for this token

params._propertyToken: Address of the property token contract

params.newPrice: New price per token in wei

setTransferLimitExempt(address,bool).details: Sets transfer limit exemption for an account

params.exempt: Whether the account is exempt from transfer limits

params.newMaxBurn: New maximum burn percentage in basis points
params.newMaxTransfer: New maximum transfer percentage in basis points

stakeTokens(uint256,uint256).details: Allows users to stake tokens for bonus yield

params.lockPeriod: Period to lock tokens in seconds

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Override the transfer function to enforce transfer limits

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Override the transferFrom function to enforce transfer limits

unstakeTokens(uint256).details: Allows users to unstake tokens after lock period

returns._0: Amount of tokens unstaked and yield earned
